description: EulerPhi is iterated with initial value n!; a(n) = first (maximal) power of 2 arising during iteration.
example: n=10, initial v.=3628800, the iteration chain is: {3628800,829440,221184,73728,24576, 8192,4096,2048,1024,512,256,128,64,32,16,8,4,2,1}. The first power of 2 is the 6th term, arising after 5 iterations of Phi,its value is 8192.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Feb 25 2000
